title: (x) "Vote or Die" narrow college slab - Flyer Font Straight {Skylar Fein}
content:
Does anyone know the name of the “vote or die” Typeface?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029023841im_/http:/typophile.com/files/VoteorDie_3843.PNG.png)

 [‹ (x) Fat straight-sided sans with ink traps - Neil Bold {Paul Hunt}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029023841/http:/typophile.com/node/28742 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Deckjunkies" bold compact sans - National Debt {Lex} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029023841/http:/typophile.com/node/28790 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ninogenio

comments.content: yes, niñogenio, do not put the ñ to avoid computer problems, any clue of the type face?
I think there was a digital font from the early ’90s like this called Ivy League.
This is [Flyer Fonts Straight](http://web.archive.org/web/20081029023841/http:/houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=13&subpage=viewfonts) by House Industries.
